review: I have eaten here several times. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Food is always great. The managers at the Ft. Lauderdale location need to spend some time here to see how a Friday's should operate.

I went expecting horrible service and a chaotic environment based on previous reviews. I'm glad we stopped in because it was a good experience. We were a party of 3 and were seated immediately. Shay was our server and she did a fantastic job. She didn't come right away but within 5 minutes she was there and was attentive the remainder of the time and always with a smile on her face! The people writing bad reviews about the loudness, crappy service, and long wait times, etc must be going during peak times and/or super late at night as they are open until 2am. We went on a Saturday night at around 7:30/8:00pm and there was no DJ. They even had a lady walking around making balloons for the kids for tips. She made my daughter a beautiful unicorn! Maybe it was our server that made the experience better so ask for Shay, if she is working!

NEVER use the bathroom in TGI Fridays in the Oakwood Plaza. I told the manager that the bathroom was dirty and had period blood on the toilet seats and it needed to be cleaned. She went in there with gloves on and some brown paper towels. She had NO cleaning supplies in her hand. This long blonde haired heifer (who is the manager with a nasty attitude might I add) dispensed the foam soap that is placed there for hand washing, onto the brown napkin and wiped the toilet down. Wheeeere was the bleach, the Lysol spray, the toilet disinfectant, something??????? She nasty.

Walked in at 10pm on Sunday night. Plenty of tables and at least a 30 minute wait. No self seating at bar table even tho 3 were open. Waited 10 min and got a bar table. Waited 10 min and still not served or clean bar. Left without any acknowledgement. Saw female manager wandering around without much sense of urgency or direction. No help at all. Id stear clear. If its like this on a sunday imagine fri or sat.
Thank you Doreen!  Excellent service and food!
Ate a late dinner here with some friends after seeing a movie. The food was decent and reasonably priced. The service was good.
Fast, comfy, like being home. It does needs more variety with the food. Love the bartenders and waitstaff, everybody is very nice.

I haven't been to Fridays in ages but when a client wanted to meet here for lunch, who was I to argue? The 2 of us were seated in a large booth but the table was so close on either side of the seat we had to squeeze in. I moved the table practically all the way to my abs (or what are supposed to be abs!) just so she could get in.  She is much shorter than I, so her boobs touched the table. I didn't want to complain since it was only my 2nd meeting with her, so I think we both pretended we were perfectly comfortable.   Our waitress was friendly and attentive.  My client ordered off their lunch menu- soup and fried shrimp.  I  had the black bean burger with mac n cheese instead of fries. The burger was topped with onions and sliced avocado.  It was tasty and the mac n cheese wasn't bad either.  When the food was delivered they brought out 2 burgers but I only ordered 1 so they took it back.   Our waitress presented our check and I rarely look at my bill but when I saw the total was $30+ for 2 lunches and water, I was a little suspicious. I was charged for the 2 burgers. I brought it to her attention and it was quickly rectified. I don't think it was intentional just an oversight.  It was typical American fare but not worth rushing back for.  P.s. I managed to get out of the booth after eating!

Oh T.G.I. Friday`s you and fantastic memories go hand-in-hand like two giddy school girls in pigtails skipping towards their favorite ice cream shop:   Parties of 15+ early twenty some-thing's, BFF's chattering aspirations of future ventures...   Sharing hopes and dreams and good laughs.  Servers singing "Happy Birthday" off key and out of tune.  And everyone thinking it was a hoot! Who cared if the service wasn't stellar? We never thought this was Barton G's. Just a decent place to get some food before heading out to the movies.  Besides, we were having a party!  Coming to T.G.I. Friday's one should not expect the type of service that you would get at a boutique or  high-end restaurant. Thinking this way will only lead to a bad experience as certainly much rests on expectations. The servers are green just getting their foot in the door before they move on to better things.  The service can often be slow, or too fast, or too pushy- or not pushy enough.. not quite on the money, but never overwhelmingly upsetting.   They aren't rude or smell funky.  They mean well, and aren't ever offensive.   The food is for the most part a 5 on a scale of 1-10.  There isn't anything horribly or extra special, just middle of the pack.  But they are open late night, they have drink specials, offer meal deals, there's enough space for a baby cart, the bathrooms are pretty clean and they have enough space for large LOUD PARTIES!  Sure you can go to a swanky club at SoBe and drop 3K on your B'day, but that's not everyone's price point. Try the brownie with a shot of Bailey's - it's a pretty fantastic mix of sweet and scandal.

As a traveler, TGI Friday's has always been a "safe haven" - good atmosphere, service, and predictable food. Dropped by this one after arriving in Ft. Lauderdale, and finally had someone take notice after nearly 10 minutes at the bar.  One bartender was too busy hitting on the women in the other side of the bar (who arrived well after I did), kitchen help was behind the bar getting himself something to drink. When I was finally served (I got ribs), I had to ask for ketchup for my fries, and wet wipes for my fingers. Worst restaurant customer service experience I've had in years.  I think I'll skip TGI Fridays in the future and go to Chilis or something.

Got an appetizer plate, 3 potato skins, 4 pot stickers and a bunch of boneless wings. Potato skins had very little piece of cheese and a small piece of bacon. Pot stickers were the bedt, the boneless wings had a very bland sauce. Quick and friendly service at the bar, but I can say the quality of food not as I remember from previous visits. Still, it was cheap and quick.

Josh the bar tender is not  a nice person.  Completely rude and degrading.  I work right next to this place and probably will never go back just for the way Josh spoke to me and my friend.   He is no good at customer service and doesn't know how to take a joke.  Go to Friday's but avoid them at the bar if Josh is working. Even after weeks of avoiding.  One night I decided to go in. Of coarse the dreaded bar tender was there.   He made it a point to comment on my negative YELP review.  Guess what dude if you weren't rude and treated all your costumers equality you wouldn't have a bad yelp review.   Just saying.

Wow, the service here is the worst. It never fails, every time I come here for lunch, I can bet on spending at least an hour in a half at this location. And I consider myself a fast eater!  The food is standard TGI Friday flare; consistent in terms of flavor and portion size with every other TGI Friday restaurant I've ever been to. But the experience is always overshadowed by the lack of service. The lack of urgency from the staff, especially during the workday lunch hour, is very disheartening.  Come on guys!

It has been awhile since I was here last. On a positive note the inside is renovated again that opens up the bar area to the restaurant. As for the menu it is in a book which makes no sense to have such an extensive menu. I ordered potstickers app as a main course  my husband and step don shared the artichoke dip. For dinner my step son had a burger and my husband a French dip. Was the food exceptional or memorable no. It was just fast food served in a restaurant setting. My husband ordered a specialty Long Island ice tea asked the server if it was good but since he was in training he did not know. It didn't taste good so the drink was sent back and he had a bottled bud instead. The $8.50 was credited in check and I was surprised a domestic beer was $4.50 each. We probably will not return again as it was not great experience food was frozen,micro waved, and served. Very lack luster experience we prefer Chili's.

Unlike everyone else on here, I did get pretty good service. I was at the bar with my guy and we were well taken care of. HOWEVER...ROACHES. Sadly, after we ate, we saw a small roach on the bar. I ended up killing it. I looked over to my left and saw two more, larger ones. One was on someone's food and another was crawling on the bar. We promptly pointed out the critters, paid our bill and got the hell out of there.  I can deal with a lot of things service-wise and food-wise, but roaches are a no-go. Seriously, if you're like me and my guy and want to watch the NBA finals and enjoy good drinks, head across the parking lot to Dave & Buster's. Better food, good drinks and roach free.

This place brings back memories of my youth. I have been coming to this chain since they opened and developed a craving for the Jack Daniel's Sauce they put on the burger and ribs. They also keep up with the time and offer little deals allthetime, in fact, I had to bar them from an email address I got so many STRIPES OFFERS. The food is of the "finger and toy " variety, but that's OK for this kind of a joint. It's not as much fun at the bar as Big Daddy's and the food is not as good, but for what it is, I still like it.

This place do not eat here the place is dirty the bathrooms are dirty the food smells dirty.. If you do I bet you get sick.. They have homeless people wrapping silver ware. Dirty hands on your spoon.. I must go and puke now....

I must say this place sure has changed and for the better . New boths, new tvs, new everything . I was very impressed and the customer service was great too. The are great new high tech decorations here as well. The food was good I just had the breads ticks ok the beer sauce, the boneless hot chicken wings , and the pot stickers and they were all delicious  and the bill came out to $14 . The waitress was very nice, friendly and checked in on us regularly  in a timely manner and  the food came out promptly with very tasty sauces . I enjoyed every bite it was a overall good choice and place to come for a quick bite .

This is a typical Fridays. Slow service and decent food if you're starving. Sometimes they get your order right, other times you have to wait for them to fix it. Don't go here if you are in a hurry.   I do have to say the food has really declined. The loaded potato skins were not loaded at all.

Your typical chain restaurant but they do a pretty good job. The endless buffalo wing or appetizer special wasn't all that great you think I can, come on these appetizers you get the second order you just feel disgusting that you're actually eating these things but they're not yours are pretty good their burgers are really good and they have all those bourbon steaks those are pretty darn good

I've come here many times, but the most recent will be my last. I came with a large group of about 7-8 people, so I would understand if that made my order come a little slow. I only wanted one thing - a small order of wings with ranch. As everyone received their food and drinks, I had to resort to eating of my uncle's plate. Everyone else got appetizers and entrees, and all I wanted were the wings I've been waiting over an hour for. When the waitress came up with the bill, I told her I had not gotten my food at all. She went to check what happened and gave me some excuse I could care less to hear. Because of their mistake, they did not charge me for my wings. Now, here's the kicker...when I went home with my food (because everyone else was done eating by the time I received it), instead of flats with ranch, they gave me soggy boneles chicken with bleu cheese. Never again.

I've been a longtime Fridays customer but regrettably have found that each visit gets a bit worse. Too bad.  To start the hostess selected a dark and inaccessible table - and one of our party was in a wheelchair. That merits a lousy table?  Fortunately we moved to a table near a window.  Waiter was very friendly but the food was cold. New plates took a long time to come out.  There's a real disconnect between the wait staff and the kitchen.  Very disappointed.
The service was excellent, the food was g e at and it was brought to our table quickly. Our waiter's name was Ronald and he was very polite and patient. We will definitely be back!

Food is ok sometimes it's good sometimes it's not This time the food was so so I ordered the jack Daniels chicken strips and they have me boneless wings smh  Then after redoing my order I waited 20 min for my drink to come out and instead of apologizing the waiter just gives me my drink like I just ordered but the drink specials are ok here and I it's really convenient I live close by so 3 stars it is....

Horrible atmosphere. Dirty, messy, looking bar area. Over priced cocktails. Despicable restrooms. Over $5.00 for two club sodas to go. Not sure why anyone would go there. Couldn't bring ourselves to order food. We left.

1.Bartenders ignored me decent. 2.Food took forever to come out. 3.When they gave me the fiod they didn't say thank you have a nice day or come back soon etc. 4.Small portion high price 2 chicken breast 6 shrimp mash potatoes $16.46  5. Got here at 12:20am and leaving at 1:42am (takeout) SMFH.

This is our second  time here and it is the best part of Florida so far. Its fridays. The ppl r nice the foods great. What can i say. Great job guys! I have one thing. Whats up with the massive pieces of broccoli? Seriously way too huge

I tried the boneless wings appetizer and it was not worth telling anyone about I was really disappointed. The pieces were clearly from a frozen bag which isn't the terrible part. There was very little meat in any of the pieces that consisted mostly of fat/skin and breading. I guess I know why I come here very little.
Had great time and the food was amazing but what made it an even better experience was the friendly and outgoing server we had, Aaron. Next time you come in ask for him! You'll love him!

My wife and I went for lunch. I always like a place with lots of collectibles and TGIF has lots. Dwight I server was friendly and prompt.My wife got the $10.00 rib special,good choice tasty ribs ,good deal.I got a fish sandwich and mac n cheese.The sandwich was good ,the mac n cheese looked better then what it tasted. That's not to say it wasn't good it could 've been cheesier,but that's all Mac n cheese.It was a convenient yet decent  place to eat in the middle of a shopping day for a reasonable price.

Woahhhh Fridays! What happened to you?! I'll admit, this is one of those restaurants we settle for, but it's never been this BAD. Let me explain why, shall I? 1. The appetizers. Oh, the appetizers.  I was starving so it was my idea to order the pick three whatever it's called. Pick three but you HAVE to pick boneless or traditional wings? We chose potstickers and loaded potato skins for the other two choices. I believe there are about five disappointing appetizers to chose from. The traditional wings were small. So were the potato skins. They were the children of Papa Potato! It seriously looked like they picked them before they were fully grown. The potstickers weren't small, but they were dry. There wasn't one winner on that awful plate. It was expensive too! 12 something!  2. The entrees.  I ordered the chicken and shrimp cajun pasta. Gross. The chicken was unacceptable. I felt sorry for that poor bird who had gone to waste. It didn't even taste like chicken. Maybe it wasn't? It had no flavor whatsoever but he pasta was covered in oil, of course. The only good thing about that dish were the 5 shrimps it came with.  Hubby ordered the bacon cheddar burger. The picture was enticing but looked nothing like it, unfortunately. The onion ring was shriveled up, the cheese looked dry, the bacon was burnt, and although the waitress asked "pink or no pink" and he clearly stated he wanted medium rare, that sucker was WELL WELL done. And the fries? Stale and flavorless. I wasn't surprised at this point.  3. The service.  This is a huge pet peeve of mine. Horrible waitresses that look like they not only hate their job, but life itself.  She had no personality, and looked annoyed to be taking our order. She hardly checked up on us and it took foreverrrrr to order!  Sorry, Fridays, but you are no longer one of our "okay let's just settle for this" restaurants. Bye bye PS... I wouldn't order Captain Morgan if you're in the mood for a drink. It was definitely NOT Captain...

My friend and I had just come home from a cruise and were starving.  We were seated right away and our waiter was quick to bring our pop.  The pop didn't taste right so the waiter exchanged it immediately.  This was the ONLY positive to our visit.  After ordering I was brought my meal first.  About 10 minutes later my friend, who was getting upset, called over the waiter who said her meal was on its way out.  We waited another 10 minutes before my friend got up and asked the hostess to get the manager. (The waiter never came back to the table to check on us.)  My friend explained that I had received my 20 minutes prior and she was still waiting, but she no longer wanted the food.  The manager apologized and went back and got her food.  Again, my friend explained how upset she was and that she didn't want her food.  The manager said her meal was on the house.  I asked for my check and a box for my food.  Our waiter came back, asked me if I wanted a take out drink, handed me my takeout box, and NEVER acknowledged my friend who was sitting there with an empty glass and no food.  He never apologized, just pretended as if she wasn't there.  The manager again came back to the table with my friends food in a take out container, apologized again and said she would take care of both our checks.  As I was packing up my food the waiter brought me my check.  REALLY???  Don't they talk.  This was a horrible experience and needless to say, we will not be going back.

If you want great service and a good laugh at this location make sure you ask to be served by DWIGHT... that guy is awesome very friendly, respectful, high spirit and guarantee you great service and a good laugh. Thanks DWIGHT!!!!!!
I thought this place sucks, but I thought it was just an off day for them. However, after reading all these 1 star reviews, I guess this place is consistent in being terrible.

We came here for lunch after a business meeting and the service was terrible. It took an hour to get the food. When the food came it was cold or raw. When we asked to speak to the manager, it took 15 minutes for them to get to come to us. This place is just ridiculous.

Never go here. Most Fridays are great, but this one sucks. I'm literally writing this review as I wait for my food, which are appetizers I ordered 30 minutes ago! Our waiter is very nice about it but the people who came in 15 minutes after us have their food!

French onion soup..The bread was stale and barley any cheese in it. Not good. I ordered a medium burger I got a hockey puck and returned it back to the kitchen. (SLAM!) .. I wonder why this location sucks more than most Fridays lol.

They got my order all wrong, I order a burger well done, I got a medium rare, I order mashed potatoes instead of fries, I got fries, I tried one of the fries and it was saturated in salt, impossible to eat. Finally for a 10 dollar burger, at least I would expect a freshly grounded and hand made patty not an out of bag, pre-made patty. I am not coming back to this dump.
$3 Thursdays  appetizers 3 bucks and drinks(long islands)

Slooooooooooooooooooooooowwww!!! Our waiter was constantly apologizing and had to send manager over twice. There were only four other tables occupied in whole place and we waited over an hour to get lunch. The lunches were so bad we wound up going to Burger King.

I'm going to be brutally honest on this. First of all,  upon arrival, the host was no where to be found.  We waited a little long and all the servers or bartenders didn't even bother to welcome us let alone sit us down.  Just very poor management,  and lack of hospitality. The place had gone a new make over but I'm not feeling their new looks.  I prefer the way it was before.  When we were seated,  host told us the server will be right out shortly in a moody tone kind of brushing us off. He basically placed the menu and took off before we were even seated.  That's already several red flags and at this point we don't even feel like eating there anymore.   Server didn't come out shortly as promised.  We still had to wait longer. She took our drinks and also our food order since we use the time to figure out what we want.  Waiting time was decent.  When the food come,  I enjoyed it.  Surprisingly,  my steak came out the way I ordered.  Service wasn't that attentive though.  Plus,  my friend was waiting for a refill on his beverage which the server forgot after telling him she was going to get it.  Overall,  I was satisfied with everything BUT their poor customer service and bad management with the staff.  Especially the host.  If you're always in the back, how are you going to see and know when customers come. Unprofessional. Also if you're a host and wants to play with your phone texting your friends, at least do it in a slick manner. Don't have your phone out like you're on break. I will not be back.  I prefer ale house across the street.  Service is a lot  better there. In my opinion,  just a simple hi how are you is enough to acknowledge guests.  You won't get that kind of friendly service there.  At least with that particular host.  Vent done.

I just went there with my roommate for lunch. Dwight was our server and I cannot express how good he really was. I have never had a server with such a great attitude and willingness to serve the patron.  His attitude brightened our day, and before even getting our food I was going to rate this 5 stars. We both order the Cajun pasta & chicken which was delicious.  Throughout the meal I observed Dwight at his other tables and I could see him constantly putting smiles on the faces of the people. I've never witnessed somebody so happy to be doing what they are doing and I cannot wait to go back to once again experience his great attitude.  I work in hospitality and I wish that all of my employees exhibited even half of the positive attitude he brings to the table.  Thank you again Dwight, and we will be seeing you again soon.

When there's nothing else around or when the rest of the group wants to eat here, I settle for this. On Thursdays now, they have $3 drinks and $3 apps which is ok.  The only thing I enjoy from Friday's in the Pink Punk Cosmo. It's a cosmo that is poured onto cotton candy. It's delicious and fair priced. Aside from that, food is not the best.
Went here about a month ago. All I can say is that I am never going back! Service was atrocious and the food wasn't good. I normally like Friday's, but this location needs major improvement.

First of all, fast food? There was a long wait just to get food, of that quality. The restaurant was much nicer than a fast food restaurant, though. We went on Tuesday, when kids eat free (the other restaurant in the area was the same deal). I wouldn't have paid for the meal. The kids menu was much, much more limited than the regular one. I ordered some sliders and a side salad. The sliders were blackened around the outside, there was barely any cheese, and I almost lost a tooth on how hard it was. The salad looked and tasted premade. On the other hand, the adults in our party enjoyed their meals, and they were much better quality then ours. Well, it was food.

Horrible service! From the moment that I stepped in till the time that I left! When we first walked in there was no host to greet us, we just stood there along with a whole bunch of ppl that were also waiting to be seated. Finally a waiter came up to us and said the host was in the back preparing tables and will be right with us, when she finally came she was not friendly at all. Her whole demeanor was as if she didn't wanna be there. Our waiter was a sweetheart BUT kept forgetting to bring us what he asked for, AND to make matters worst he really messed up on my order. I had to send it back, I ordered a burger with no pickles and tomatoes and he bought it to me with everything that I didn't want in it. He also bought my daughter honey mustard sauce for her chicken fingers after we told him BBQ, when we finally bought that up to his attention he kept walking pass our table attending to everyone else and still FORGOT to return back with the BBQ sauce. When the bill finally came I couldn't believe that they tried to CHARGE me TWICE for the same burger! They messed my order up and I sent it back but yet they wanted me to pay for it! Well guess what?! It wasn't happening! I paid for  the one that I ate and that was the end of it! I WILL NOT BE RETRUNING BACK TO THIS PARTICULAR FRIDAY'S! AND U SHOULDN'T NEITHER!

Worst Cobb Salad!! The salad was served without the chicken, was told chicken for salad would be right out??!! -had to wait to see someone to call manager- she did have another salad make that included chicken - chicken wings cold- won't come back (waitress good)

Fridays used to be the best but we were down to this location as the last good Fridays.  Today it joined the rest of them as substandard. I ordered takeout from there as we have many times in the past. When I got the food home the tostado nachos were completely charred black and just piled in the container on top of each other the condiment containers thrown in on top of the food. The mozzarella sticks were ice cold and the marinara sauce was cold too. When I drove all the way back to the restaurant to have them fix the order they apologized and brought a new order that again was just piled into a take out container.  I'm afraid that I will not be returning to TGI Friday's again.

Hmm, now that I see the other ratings, maybe this is just the location. Sadly, TGIF has been slipping in years past - I am a loyal TGIF alumnae from Mpls in the 90's! But Hollywood is up there with the bottom of the metro area...it's all about staffing. Loved the Dixie/U-M location when I lived closer, but sadly many others in area are inconsistent in all areas of cleanliness, quality and hospitality! Check out Outback, Gyroville or Ale House depending on your needs.

If I could give less than one star for this location, I would. I have been a customer of this particular location for over 12 years. I loved it so much to the point that even though I moved to Pompano Beach, I would still drive all the way to Hollywood for Fridays. My last 2 visits here were atrocious! Last night took the cake! I'd been celebrating my 30th birthday all weekend and wanted to end it with dinner at Fridays with my family. I should've left immediately after being seated. The Host(?) that seated us was awful. He did not speak a single word to us. When we were led to a table he simply pointed for us to sit. The table hadn't even been bused yet and the floor was covered with food underneath! He set our menus down (which is how we knew he REALLY was going to sit us there). My husband asked if he could please have someone clear the table and sweep the food off the floor. The guy rolled his eyes and moved us to a less dirty table. The prior patrons checks were still on the new table. The "Host" picked them up and we sat down. Luckily I keep some disinfectant wipes in my purse. No one cleaned the table so we did it ourselves. The waitress was inattentive. We had to ask for everything! Napkins, bleu cheese for our wings appetizers (we got the pick 3), utensils for my son, refill on my soda and water for my son, it was awful. When the plates came back for the appetizers, they actually had black, dirty water on them. My husband asked for new plates, which seemed to be an inconvenience. "New" plates came out, still slightly wet as if a rag had been passed over the top plate and had a particle of food on it. We asked another waitress passing by for new plates because these were still wet and dirty. This seemed like an inconvenience for her too. Again, the SAME plates were brought out. How do we know they were the same? Because the top plate had a distinct chip on it. It was the same chip in the same location all 3 times. The dinner was awful. My son had the chicken skewers with pita and broccoli (he LOVES broccoli). The chicken was somewhat edible. Broccoli was gross. It tasted very old. (When I saw my son wasn't enjoying his food like he usually does, my husband and I both tasted it) I had the JD ribeye with mashed potatoes and the tomato/mozzarella salad. The steak was tough and very salty, mashed potatoes were dry, and the tomatoes were waaayyyyyyyyyy over ripe. They were soft and wrinkled. I love caprese salad....this was gross. I took 3 bites of my steak, 2 bites of potatoes, 1 tomato,  and one mozzarella. I left most of my food on the plate. My husband had the JD full rack ribs. Let's just say he had to cover it in ketchup to be able to eat it! We asked for the manager and he removed the appetizer from our bill (the only  thing we actually ate!) We tipped because they have to make a living. We usually tip 20% or more depending on how happy we are with our service. They used to have a waitress named Andrea about 10 years ago who was amazing! We always tipped her 50% (on bills of $100+) because she was fantastic! The girl from last night got 13%....and that's only because it would round up our total to $60. I will never...EVER go to Fridays again. Not to ANY location! Food and service has deteriorated immensely!! Stay clear of them!!!! (Please note, they were not even busy! very few tables filled.)

Service was good. Got in pretty quick . Food was flavorless, we order two appetizers, the spinach dip and loaded potato skins, and both were terrible, then I got the NEW blue cheese burguer ( waisted money ) and my wife got the Chicken and Shrimp and was overcooked and really small !!!! Our server was nice and the drink my wife got was the Guava Mojito and it was delicious !!!! I might give them another chance but who knows !
Reall bad service and really poor management stay away from this location go to ale house right across the street
Had lunch with the family. Fairly busy for 3:00 but it was Sunday. Food took way to long to arrive but was not bad.

Kyle is so knowledgeable he didn't hesitate on any of the millions of questions my grandmother and sister asked him! He was very nice and helpful I definitely think he deserves a raise and employee of the month every month. Im a waitress and I really admire his attitude and intellect.
For a chain, this place is good!  Awesome specials Tues - Thurs!
I've never eaten somewhere like this absolutely phenomenal I will definitely think about this place everytime I want to go eat I recommend to anyone who loves food and great waiters and waitresses

First time at this Fridays. Nice place like every other. They sat us fast our waitress was ahh ok. Me and my coworker was going to watch twilight but caught a bite to eat. The food was very tasty and the mouth watering cheesecake its to die for. Ill be back if ever on this side of town its ok.

It's Friday's... You all know it. If you don't just think of about any other chain restaurant/bar. Food with too much salt and too many JD sauce options. Drink menu is pretty substantial and tends to be pretty consistent from one to the other. If you need a quick bite and are nearby, OK. But, certainly don't go out of your way to get here.

I was really disappointed with this location. The gentleman that seated us and the guy that brought our utensils were genuinely friendly and helpful but our main waitress and the two other waitresses that brought our food had bad attitudes and were very condescending in their service. It was obvious they didn't want to be there and didn't want to serve us. One of my dining companions ordered chicken which had to be sent back because it was noticeably undercooked, although our waitress tried to argue otherwise and again had an attitude about taking it back and bringing a new one.  The desserts were quite tasty but save yourself the bad service and go to a different location.
Wonderful service, great food, attentive staff and floor manager. The restaurant must be under the new management (was hesitant to come and dine here based on the previous three reviews).

Starting with the pros: There was no wait during lunch we were seated immediately.   $3 Appletini was good with a nice kick.  Cons: we ordered the new Bones Basket...ribs and chicken on top of the fries making the fries soggy. The meal is advertised as a shareable meal for $19 not a good value at all from Friday's expected more from this meal. Not a usual Friday's portion for the price.  The waitress didn't come back to offer refill on drinks until she came back w the bill.

We came on a Friday thinking this would be a quick dinner type of thing...little did we know! We order our drinks and food and after 40 minutes of waiting, one plate came out. Then 10 minutes after that, he second plate came out. The steak that was supposed to have been well done was actually more medium and more room temperature too.  The jack Daniels sampler wasn't all that hot (temperature wise) either.  The broccoli that came with the steak looked pretty bad too. We didn't return anything because if it took the kitchen 40 minutes to get our dishes out on a relatively empty restaurant, god only knows what we would've gotten back.

We came by for quick bite and drinks. I had strawberry mule that was on special. The flavor was ok but they blended the ice like a icy and that ruined everything. It also came with literally one thinly sliced strawberry. Very disappointed. We decided to try Mac and cheese burger which looked yummy on the menu. The taste was ok, basically eating side of Mac and cheese.

Came to celebrate a birthday with friends and family. We were a party of 12 so the 10 minute wait was not a problem. I ordered the spinach and queso dip as an appetizer and the flat iron steak with mashed potatoes and Mac & cheese as my entree. The spinach and queso dip was definitely a favorite. The steak had just enough pink and was tender and juicy. The mashed potatoes had no taste to them, definitely could have been better. The Mac & cheese was also bland with no noticeable taste. I now know which sides not to choose on my next visit.

Started off slow and tapered off.  This is THE place to go if you want the bait and switch. What do I mean by that?  Items that look in the photographs way better than you'll ever get.  If you get waited on in a reasonable time, consider yourself leaps and bounds ahead. Heck, go out and buy a lottery ticket because you must be one in a million.  I told the server the burger was horrible. His response was, "Good to know."  Duncan, I'm sorry you obviously don't care about your job and that's fine with me.  Can I have a different server then?  This was honestly the worst hamburger I've had. It's the type of hamburger that makes Burger King taste gourmet. My dinner companion took a bite and told me he thought it was "disgusting."  He said, "It almost ruined burgers for me, completely."  I could barely eat 1/2 of it.  Michelle stopped by and did her best to make it right. I appreciate her honesty and sincerity. Apparently Duncan is new. I'll chalk it up to a learning opportunity; however, I wouldn't come back.  Yelp 100 Challenge 2017: 8 of 100!

Sat at the bar Trevor greeted us, he was pleasant and brought our drinks. He was busy at the service bar and asked his co worker Tara (or should I say Tara-ble) to take our order, she then said she was busy to him. By the time she made her way to us I got 10 percent of my order in before she started to walk away as if I was bothering her, I had to shout the rest of my order to her, she simply said ok. There was no warmth nothing not even eye contact or a simple thank you. We recieved our food she didn't check back, when we called her over for more sauce she asked someone else who never brought it. When we  asked again she blamed the other server. Needless to say it felt like we were unwanted not the experience I want in a BARTENDER , there are plenty more places to go to.
Hey @TGIFridays You can't called it "Endless Apps" if you stopped serving me after my 3rd app.  I ordered the 4th app and it never came!

Yum Yum Yum!! The food is always good here. I have eaten here over 25 times and I have never had a problem. Most people get a burger, but honestly I recomend the endless apps. I know its just apps but it NEVER ends!!! Good place to go with family and friends. Very cheap for top quality food.

Omg one of the most rude hosts I've ever come across! WOW! Black male with glasses!!! WOW!!! To think this is the first face and attitude you come across walking into an establishment! Attitude like that should be in the back cleaning dishes.

This place is busy so get it that it takes time get a table or for food to be cooked for a pickup order. The problem is some of the staff is extremely rude and dismissive. Every time I have placed an order for pickup they never have the order ready at the time THEY stated. I'm only talking about two hamburgers and some fries.

Very disappointed in the staff lack of customer service skills and abilities. I ordered a simple Salmon Cesar with Kale. I had to pick out for leaves of Kale that we're rotten. I showed the brown steamed Kale to the waitress and her response was "it looks okay to me... but I'm not a Kale person". So disappointing. I won't be coming back to this location. She then told me the manager looked at the Kale you pick out and she agrees with me. They took away the plate with the rotten kale before I could take a picture, the salmon was cook perfect though
Nice restaurant the salmon is great the bartender are absolutely the best great place to hang out at

Came with a group of 10 people. They say is pretty quickly on a Saturday night at about 10:00pm. The food came out pretty quickly and it was delicious. Some people in the party had cold fries, but the waiters brought out fresh and hot fries pretty quickly. The drinks were delicious. Got a shot of patron and the waitress brought me a double shot! I wil def be back at this location.
This place is always packed and the service is always good. Kudos to the manager for having a great team

Service was slow,felt like they forgot about us.  the food was good. I founded a little disturving to see a dog by the bar. It was on a ladies lap but it didn't look right, so close to food.There were some flies buzzing where we were. we had a booth across from d bar.
The service is  really going down hill  here and it's not the same manger can't be everywhere at one time from the tables to the bar isn't good SAD

It's really 3 1/2 stars but because we like our bartender, who actually remembered the drinks we liked, automatically rounded up to 4 stars.   The service we received from him was always excellent.  The appetizer we ordered was decent.  The new Tiki cocktail I tried called "pain eraser" was pretty good.  For $5.00 more you can keep the glass.  Probably will come back again just to have that cocktail again!

Sat at the bar which hadn't been cleaned yet from previous customers. There were 2 bartenders 1 was very nice and attending the other was a bit rude. We were having a drink before a movie. I ordered 1 appetizer and it took so long I almost had to cancel it. Usually TGIFS are better than this.

*sigh* Not that long ago I had a bad experience at a Fridays in Orlando.  I swore I would never step into this franchise again, but alas, here I am again.   My daughter and I decided on Fridays because it was the closest open restaurant in the area and because we like the mozzarella sticks.  We were immediately seated and greeted by a very friendly waiter, Joe.  He was quick to take our order and have our drinks and appetizers brought out to us.  So far so good, right?  well, not so fast...enter our entrees.  We each ordered chicken quesadilla.  My daughter's quesadilla was drenched in oil.  I mean, it looked like they poured an entire bottle of oil right on top of the quesadillas.  Mine were also drenched in oil and the bottom of the quesadilla was soggy as a result.  We sent both quesadillas back and Joe was very understanding, so I appreciate that.  He returned with new quesadillas that were ALSO drenched in oil!  Disgusting!  Once again we returned my daughter's and instead ordered the chicken tenders, because we figured that was the safest choice.  WRONG!  That TOO was a disaster!  Then, to add insult to injury, the manager comes out to speak to us and when I explained what the issue was she looked at me like I was absurd.  Like how dare I send food back that was utterly disgusting.  Then she came up with a reason why the food was gross, "because we use butter on the grill and that gets on the quesadillas."  Great, but how many buckets of butter are you using on ONE quesadilla?  I don't understand how the chef thought those two quesadillas were worthy of being considered a meal.   Terrible.  I have zero desire (again) to ever walk into a Fridays (again).

What more can you ask from them. Cheap food and drinks are really hard to mess up. The service was amazing and the place is nice too. It's a chain so if you been to one you've been to all of them.  How do they make money when they sell you $10 apps? Yes they want to sell you drinks and that fine  My bill was $40 with some good food.
Got into Florida late on Thanksgiving. This place stayed open with full on thanksgiving dinner. TGIF, thank you!

Walked in and the three hostesses were hot and heavy into gossip and did not even look up or acknowledge me. I should have known better and walked out but took a seat at the bar. Probably the loudest venue I have ever been in, sat there with both fingers in my ears. No one ever asked how meal was, place next to me at bar stayed messed up from previous diner,chicken bones and all the whole time I was there. Jeesh!

Can I put zero stars? I didn't even get in the restaurant!! As I was in the parking lot reading the terrible reviews - me and my 10 month old - about 10 fools were in the parking lot fighting! That made my decision and probably saved me some money and my life .

Where's the beef? Probably the same place their customer service is. The waitress argued with my friend and I about  food we ordered that was missing food items. Horrible customer service but good deals on drinks.

I have not been here in a while and just had went there with a friend about three weeks ago. We ordered appetizers and our entrees. Am not impatient kind of person but wow this place needs to improve on the timeframe we waited for just for our appetizers a hour and a half. There was not a full house there ehither. I already had my fill of soda for the night and waiter was trying to apologize and offer me a free cheesecake. I commend the guy for at least noticing that my stomach was talking so, thumbs up! But we got are pasta shrimp the same time we got our appetizers am like wow but you will not see me in this restaurant for long time to come
It must stand for Thank God It Feelsgood, 'cuz it did at this Friday's.  Was it good feng shui?  I dunno, but very pleasant dining experience.  Oh, and I had a kid's meal too.
The food was a completely disaster, everything was cold and extremely dry, the drinks did not have any alcohol basically like virgin drinks. Very unsatisfied and will definitely not recommend it!

Delicious!! I love TGI Fridays, and this location is no different!! I went for a pick up order on a Saturday, and the place was packed!! I loved how the manager voluntarily got involved to make sure I got my order promptly!! Ill be back!!

I come to this place few times a month and never have a good experience. Sad to say I love the sizzling chicken & shrimp but it ducks the other closest one is 20min away. These people rarely pick up calls, then have the voicemail set up as a normal lady talking and not even referring to Friday's which is weird. Then the manager there never cares when you complain about the service or food being cold. Always a issue here I tell ya, been eating at Friday's since 2010 n I'm not gonna stop because of a few ppl but damn this place is a travesty

Good for happy hour prices, drinks and watching the game.    The food is okay.   After coming to the various locations for years now,  I know that TGIF will update the menu and come up with new food items.  They are a long way off.     Enrolling in the TGIF Rewards points is one good feature.      Service was slow for a Friday.   Our food came out before the appetizer.    The bathroom, at least the ladies room because I didn't go into the men's room,  needed attention and I would suggest to the manager to stick to a regular maintenance schedule.

I must say the staff here is amazing! Especially Jaime who actually went to the back to make my friend his guacamole! Now that is service. Jaime is at the bar. But man, she is awesome! Thank you guys!

Terrible. I would go on a long winded review but this place is just bad. We waited an hour for our server (Bradley) to even bring the food and when my French dip arrive I could have swore they just went to a 7/11, bought a little sand which, threw it in the microwave and served it to me. After waiting an hour for my food, I didn't want to reorder considering I would have to wait another hour to eat. Please avoid if you want to eat a decent meal.

I hadn't been to a Fridays in a few years & this visit quickly reminded me why I had steered clear for so long. We walked in with a sizable party to celebrate a birthday so we waited while a table was ready. This wasn't peak hours, it was well after 10pm on a Thursday so the place wasn't packed or anything. Once we were seated, we waited... & waited... until eventually we flagged down a server. One of the guys in our party decided he was going to order to-go in the hopes he could get his food quicker. The waitress laughed & told him that it would make no difference as all of our orders were being placed at the same time.  Fast forward 25 minutes later when his food was given to him. He had ordered quite a bit of food & yet it was here & ready. We wait... & wait some more... one full hour after he had eaten his meal(he graciously shared with us as we sat starving) our food started to trickle in. With my luck, my order was wrong & I had to wait even longer for it to be replaced. After quite an extensive search, we were able to locate the manager on duty to explain the horrendous situation. We were told the order had been placed in the system wrong which caused the delay. I don't know whether this was the case but we took her word for it.  The manager brought a free dessert for our friends birthday & gave us a small break on the check which was a nice gesture. This is what a good manager is supposed to do when something like this occurs, I just wish she was easier to locate when everything was happening. Unfortunately, the damage was done. I don't think anyone in our party will ever return to a Fridays. This experience was a nightmare.
Will never go there again. Bad food, worst service, 30 min to get waited on, 45 min to get cold food unbelievable save you money and try MC LOL

I have always had the worst experience at this place. Please don't ask me why I kept coming back lol. But this time (August 28, 2017) was different! I mean, seriously, amazing service! Our server was Joseph and honestly for TGI Friday's he went above and beyond. Always smiling, never complaining, he gave us suggestions. He knew it was my moms birthday and got his crew to sing happy birthday anyway without us asking for it. Great customer service! This guy deserves great things! Thanks Joe! Hope you get to see this.

I hate to complain. Friendly waitress and staff however not happy about the food and drinks... took a long time to get our waters. Asked for henny and strawberry, hardly any henny...if it was actually henny my sister couldn't tell. I got the French dip and the fries were barely warm, au jus broth was freezing cold. Only one small clump of bleu cheese on my sisters salad too. I always enjoyed tgifridays but I won't be visiting again.

HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE...STAY AWAY FROM THIS LOCATION.  The bartender. Steven, had a bad attitude and even worse service. It took 20 minutes to get a glass of wine. The appetizer came out after the meal. The Manager, Heath Bloom, did a mumbled 'drive by' apology behind our back for Steven's bad service without even stopping. The rest of our meal was spent overhearing Steven tell other customers how bad the kitchen is. This location really needs to get it together. The chips were soggy (probably from sitting on the bar for a half hour), the steak fries were cold, the steak was over done (again probably from sitting around a while). The bathroom had paper towels everywhere on the cabinet and floor. EWE....This location has really take a dive. Judging from the other multiple one star reviews, they do not pay attention to their customers or social media!

Keep driving - wish I had.  Ordered boneless wings and a Cobb salad. Wings were only ok, but salad and lots of brown lettuce and was missing a few ingredients. When check came, wings were double what they should have been, special price not applied . Service was ok but not great by any stretch.

AWFUL!!! Do not waste your money and time coming and this one!! The waiter (MICHAEL who supposed to be "manager too") didnt pay attention to us. Someone else bring the food but our waiter didnt give us the cuttlery, we wait 15 min until someone saw us and could ask for it. We ate and thw food was already cold.. And bad!! The ribs were TOOOOOOO small.... Ah! Also the coke werent sparkling at all...(btw i just write this here in the local.. Still hungry....) Ah!! The french fries were more salt and pepper with french fries: OVERLY SALTY

Sometimes it's nice to see familiar restaurants when traveling.  We came here late after a tough day and with two active young boys we asked to be seated off the main dining room and they were able to accommodate and seat us right away.  Our server was patient and so helpful even with spilled milk.   My jack Daniels chicken was prepared as usual!  Thanks!

location: East Side Costa Mesa, Costa Mesa, CA
review: Worst TGI Fridays I have ever been too!! The service was horrible! We were a party of 9 and all our food was cold! There was mistakes on our orders.  Our alcohol drinks had no alcohol (we ordered Mai Tais) they tasted like pineapple juice!  Coming from California her on vacation I have received a way better experience!! Did I mention one of us ordered the unlimited apps and it took 25 min to get the second one!!! Worst restaurant I have ever been too!!!

Originally was told the wait was 20 mins after almost an hour we sat at a table. The waiter was nice and tried to be attentive but I'm not sure if he was very busy or just forgot about us at times. After we were seated we received our water 20 mins later because the restaurant ran out of clean dishes (???). Finally after another hour the food arrives...well at least most of our orders. Ranch dressing forgotten, seldom offers for drink refills...I am visiting this area but I will not be back to this Friday on any day. I'd like to order some type of dessert but with the services provided I'm not certain I'd get it before closing time.

Came in last night for a take out order. After a night of studying was pretty hungry. I got back and was excited to eat but the half rack ribs that was suppose to come with my combo was missing. I called and the manager was of no help. She basically told me the kitchen was closed and nothing they can do. I went back tonight and Vinny was super helpful. I told him the issue and he took my receipt to head towards the back. In less than a minute he came out and said wait 10-15 minutes for your ribs. Within 10 minutes he saw I was waiting and automatically went to check. He then immediately came back out with my ribs and fries were now added. It was such an inconvenience to have to go back to Friday's but glad I was helped by Vinny. I would give less stars but the Jack Daniel's burger I also ordered last night was really good. Vinny thank you again and you deserve some type of recognition from Friday's! They are lucky to have you working here.
The service was good although the bathrooms were really smelly. Went yesterday Sunday afternoon for a big party. It was clean but smelled like pee

Dont eat at Fridays they dont care if you have an issue....I had a problem at another restaurant and given "be our guest" certificates...when I tried to use them here ..."oh we cant take these" but they will make sure Im taken are of...well its been a month an nothing no response to calls or anything.

My husband and I stopped in at this location while on vacation, and we had a great experience. We must give a special shout-out to our server, Joseph. He was absolutely wonderful. He made us feel very welcome, and we had a great conversation with him during our visit.  The food was great and was brought out to us in a timely manner. If we are able to, we will come back to this location again, and we will ask for Joseph as as our server.
